reasoning: Extremely rare genetic syndrome characterized by sparse hair, enamel hypoplasia, conical teeth, palmoplantar keratoderma, and partial cutaneous syndactyly. Prevalence less than 1 per 1,000,000 worldwide. US population estimate fewer than 1,000 people. Only 9 cases described in medical literature. Multiple subtypes exist with overlapping features.
source: GARD (Genetic and Rare Diseases Information Center); Orphanet database
